definition: see 通假字[tong1 jia3 zi4]
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
variant of 借[jie4]
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
IOU/receipt for a loan

sentences.english: Take advantage of word and score multiplying power-ups as well as Discard and Hint Accumulators .
sentences.chinese: 借字和分数乘以功率波动以及抛弃暗示和蓄电池。

definition: nonstandard form of a Chinese character
loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
sound and meaning
phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
the meaning of a phonetic loan character 假借字[jia3 jie4 zi4] acquired from a similar-sounding word (e.g. 而[er2] originally meant "beard" but acquired the meaning "and")
modern (i.e. not ancient) pronunciation of a Chinese character
original form of a Chinese character
old character/archaic form of a Chinese character
phonetic value of a character

to explain/to interpret/interpretation
homophonic characters
ancient (esp. pre-Qin) pronunciation of a Chinese character/classical speech sounds
variant pronunciation (when the same character has more than one reading)
standard pronunciation/to correct sb's pronunciation
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
